message: Bit of a poll, how is your development server set up on osx? XAMPP? MAMP? Homebrew/Macports? OSX's Apache/PHP
It should be exactly how your web servers are setup, I would use nginx

@firebathero Never used OSX for dev, but on Windows I use WAMP. I tried the windows version of XAMPP, but WAMP seemed to function a little better. Another thing I've done is set up an Ubuntu Server VM on my machine, then link a folder from OSX into the VM's web root.
I use Vagrant or a virtual machine with image of production server. As for package manager, I've been pretty happy with Homebrew.

@italiano40 You know, I'm a fan of OSX, but I just don't have the money to shell out for a powerbook. I'd rather stick with Ubuntu on a PC (every bit as good as OSX IMO), but sometimes you just have to use windows as work. I actually just landed a new job building sites using ASP.Net(C#), so while I would rather be doing PHP, Ruby, Python, etc, I do what pays the bills.

@CrowderSoup do you know that OSX is becoming developers number one operating system if you saw the tech crunch hackaton, only a handful of pc's were there so OSX is becoming really strong in dev, thanks to the intel core processor
I use crunchbang Linux all that stuff is just an apt-get away
MAMP Pro does pretty much everything i need it to do and it crazy simple to get working
